context_of_use: The customer interacts with the system to find and evaluate products.
description: Allow customers to browse and search product listings and view product details to support purchase decisions.
triggering_event: Customer initiates a product search or browsing action.
preconditions: Customer is logged into the system.
postconditions: Customer can view product listings and details.
assumptions: The system has a database of products categorized appropriately.
requirements_met: The system allows browsing products by category.
The system allows searching for products by keyword.
The system allows viewing product details.
main_flow: 1. Customer selects a product category → System displays products in that category.
2. Customer enters a keyword to search → System displays search results matching the keyword.
3. Customer selects a product to view details → System displays detailed information about the selected product.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): Customer selects a sub-category → System displays products in that sub-category.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): No products found for the entered keyword → System displays a message indicating no results.
information_for_steps: 1. Product categories and their respective products.
2. Search keyword entered by the customer.
3. Product details including specifications, price, and availability.
